Description: Pottery vase of straw tempered Nile silt of drop shape with round base and rolled rim.
Curator's comments: This vase is from Garstang’s excavations in the Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, but was not found within a grave and is marked only with F (for Fort) on the exterior. For publication of the surviving records of Garstang’s excavations see B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, London (1987). Like Rough ware R65b in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
